results.name: 'Reverse and Add' carried out in base 2 (cf. A062128); number of steps needed to reach a palindrome, or -1 if no palindrome is ever reached.
comment: The analog of A033665 in base 2.
link: Index entries for sequences related to Reverse and Add!
Klaus Brockhaus, On the'Reverse and Add!' algorithm in base 2
mathematica: limit = 10^4; (* Assumes that there is no palindrome if none is found before "limit" iterations *)
program: (ARIBAS): function b2reverse(a: integer): integer; var n,i,rev: integer; begin n := bit_length(a); for i := 0 to n-1 do if bit_test(a,i) = 1 then rev := bit_set(rev,n-1-i); end; end; return rev; end; function a066057(mx,stop: integer); var c,k,m,rev: integer; begin for k := 0 to mx do c := 0; m := k; rev := b2reverse(m); while m <> rev and c < stop do inc(c); m := m + rev; rev := b2reverse(m); end; if c < stop then write(c); else write(-1); end; write(" "); end; end; a066057(120,300).
